trans-unit.source: Handling Graph Errors
trans-unit.target: Handling Graph Errors

trans-unit.source: Client applications that use the Graph API should implement error handling logic to react as gracefully as possible to varying conditions and provide the best experience possible to their customers.
trans-unit.target: Client applications that use the Graph API should implement error handling logic to react as gracefully as possible to varying conditions and provide the best experience possible to their customers.

trans-unit.source: The topic discusses the types of errors that the Azure Active Directory Graph Service returns and provides general guidance on how to handle them.
trans-unit.target: The topic discusses the types of errors that the Azure Active Directory Graph Service returns and provides general guidance on how to handle them.

trans-unit.source: For a list and description of Graph API error codes, see <link xlink:href="751eef3e-d4d9-41e4-94bf-55bf39ae2549" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure AD Graph Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For a list and description of Graph API error codes, see <link xlink:href="751eef3e-d4d9-41e4-94bf-55bf39ae2549" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure AD Graph Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Types of Errors
trans-unit.target: Types of Errors

trans-unit.source: Graph API errors occur in the following categories.
trans-unit.target: Graph API errors occur in the following categories.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Client Errors</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Client Errors</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Client errors are represented by 400-series HTTP status codes.
trans-unit.target: Client errors are represented by 400-series HTTP status codes.

trans-unit.source: They include objects with invalid values, objects that are missing required properties or property values, attempting to access a non-existent resource, attempting to update a read-only property, and omitting the required authorization token.
trans-unit.target: They include objects with invalid values, objects that are missing required properties or property values, attempting to access a non-existent resource, attempting to update a read-only property, and omitting the required authorization token.

trans-unit.source: To resolve these errors, fix the underlying issue before retrying the request.
trans-unit.target: To resolve these errors, fix the underlying issue before retrying the request.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Server Errors</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Server Errors</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Server errors are represented by 500-series HTTP status codes, such as a transient directory failure.
trans-unit.target: Server errors are represented by 500-series HTTP status codes, such as a transient directory failure.

trans-unit.source: Most of these errors are transient and can be resolved by retrying the request.
trans-unit.target: Most of these errors are transient and can be resolved by retrying the request.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Network/Protocol Errors</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Network/Protocol Errors</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: A variety of network-related errors can occur while sending a request or receiving a response, such as host name resolution errors, prematurely closed connections, and SSL negotiation errors.
trans-unit.target: A variety of network-related errors can occur while sending a request or receiving a response, such as host name resolution errors, prematurely closed connections, and SSL negotiation errors.

trans-unit.source: Most of these errors cannot be resolved by retrying; the underlying issue has to be fixed.
trans-unit.target: Most of these errors cannot be resolved by retrying; the underlying issue has to be fixed.

trans-unit.source: However, some errors, such as host-name resolution failures or timeouts, might be resolved by retrying the request.
trans-unit.target: However, some errors, such as host-name resolution failures or timeouts, might be resolved by retrying the request.

trans-unit.source: Elements of Error Codes
trans-unit.target: Elements of Error Codes

trans-unit.source: Graph API errors have a formatted body that consists of an HTTP status code, a message, and values.
trans-unit.target: Graph API errors have a formatted body that consists of an HTTP status code, a message, and values.

trans-unit.source: Use the elements of the errors in your error handling logic.
trans-unit.target: Use the elements of the errors in your error handling logic.

trans-unit.source: However, some HTTP responses might not include the code/message/values response body because the request is routed through proxy and gateway services.
trans-unit.target: However, some HTTP responses might not include the code/message/values response body because the request is routed through proxy and gateway services.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to include default logic that can handle errors based on the HTTP status code alone.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to include default logic that can handle errors based on the HTTP status code alone.

trans-unit.source: The following is an example of an HTTP 400 Request_BadRequest error.
trans-unit.target: The following is an example of an HTTP 400 Request_BadRequest error.

trans-unit.source: Each message body has <parameterReference>code</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>message</parameterReference>, and <parameterReference>values</parameterReference> properties.
trans-unit.target: Each message body has <parameterReference>code</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>message</parameterReference>, and <parameterReference>values</parameterReference> properties.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Code</embeddedLabel>: Design your error-handling logic to branch based on the code.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Code</embeddedLabel>: Design your error-handling logic to branch based on the code.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Message</embeddedLabel>: A language/value tuple that represents a human-readable error message.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Message</embeddedLabel>: A language/value tuple that represents a human-readable error message.

trans-unit.source: The content is in the <parameterReference>value</parameterReference> field.
trans-unit.target: The content is in the <parameterReference>value</parameterReference> field.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, the request fails because the value of the mailNickname property is missing.
trans-unit.target: In the following example, the request fails because the value of the mailNickname property is missing.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Values</embeddedLabel>: A collection of name/value pairs that provide more information about the nature of the failure.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Values</embeddedLabel>: A collection of name/value pairs that provide more information about the nature of the failure.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, the values are Null.
trans-unit.target: In the following example, the values are Null.
